attributes.action: Increase firefighters pay!
attributes.background:
My dad is a firefighter and has been amongst the many heroes tackling the fires on the moors/winter hill.
There is such a positive response from the public recognising the gruelling work they do its just a shame their wages don't reflect this with their pay frozen & capped at 1% It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details:
Firefighters pay has been frozen and capped at 1% with inflation rising at around 3%. With their pension and national insurance contributions rising their wages have in effect dropped! 
These heroes risk their lives every day not only putting out fires but doing so much more than you could imagine and they deserve / need to have the cap lifted and their pay increased. Lets give something back to them and help get this changed!

attributes.action: Reduce the TV license fee and privatise the BBC
attributes.background:
The BBC was created as a government funded TV channel when there were very few other options. Today, with hundreds of alternative channels, the BBC is not needed.

The TV license should ONLY be for maintenance of broadcasting equipment, and the BBC should be self funded like all other TV channels.
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal is to make the BBC a privately funded channel, as all others are, with commercials and/or subscription fees. Approximately 11% of license fees are spent on the infrastructure and broadcasting equipment, the rest is spent on BBC programming and administation,  and chasing license fees. 

By making the BBC private, more people will be able to watch live TV without having to pay a hefty fee for a service they don't use.

attributes.action: Give an alternate route for couples to reach the spouse visa income requirement
attributes.background:
Each year thousands of couples are kept apart due to the strict and unrealistic financial requirements that must be met in order to obtain a UK spouse visa. 

The current requirement is £18,600 per year, this is not a small amount to earn for one individual as 3rd party income is not considered.
attributes.additional_details: This petition proposes that the financial requirement stays at £18,600, however the UK sponsor must only earn £14,966 per year (full time minimum wage). The £14,966 can then be combined with the income of a direct family member to reach the £18,600. After entry to the UK, the alien spouse has 6 months to find a job where the couple can reach £18,600 per year. This allows the government limit to stay in place while having a much fairer system.

attributes.action: Amend Representation of the Peoples act 1983 to include Social Media campaigns.
attributes.background: Where transparency and fairness within elections is said to be valued within western democracies and is enshrined in British law, social media is being used to undermine these principles and laws, meaning the current law is therefore clearly outdated and unfit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details: S.110 of the Representation of the Peoples act 1983 states that "an imprint must be added to printed election material. The electoral commission's advice on social media surrounding imprint offences however is as follows; "With the increased use of social hi-tech media there are an increasing number of allegations being made in relation to electronic material; however there is no imprint requirement here. The Electoral Commission recommends that the imprint should be provided as good practice.”

attributes.action: Abolish the out dated 'ONE MILE RULE' in the dispensing of medication in England
attributes.background: A Dickensian rule was set in the early nineteen hundreds which states that Doctors prescribe and Apothecaries dispense. Doctors could only dispense if the patient lived more than a mile from the Apothecary (as the crow flies) due to Doctors staff not being qualified.
attributes.additional_details:
Now in the 21st century,Doctors dispensing staff are as qualified in all aspects of dispensing and services as the Chemists.The One Mile Rule should now be abolished to fit the NHS White Paper headed PATIENT CHOICE,so that ALL patients in practices throughout the country have the option to choose where they would like their medications dispensed be,it Retail,Online or Doctors Dispensaries.
Therefore by abolishing the ONE MILE RULE, the Government will adhere to the heading of the NHS White Paper

attributes.action: Stop avoidable deaths: additional regulation of Diamorphine and other opiates
attributes.background:
Diamorphine should only be used for extreme pain in terminal illness. 
My husband was prescribed Diamorphine for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease and pneumonia from which he was recovering. This is wrongful prescribing and can cause death. Stricter legislation and rules are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Much stricter control on the prescribing of Diamorphine and all other opiates is needed. At least three doctors should authorise any prescription of these drugs, following open discussions with the patients and family. The wishes of the patient must be the central focus. Special training needs to be given in the prescription of opiates to doctors and pharmacists. Legislation needs to be introduced to enforce the above. Patients' safety must prevail.

attributes.action: Children to wear helmets when using a scooter
attributes.background: We need to protect our children heads when scooting. Pavements have uneven surfaces, so as not to single out any children,it should be law that all children should be made to wear helmets.It seems bizarre that there is not a law in place currently to protect our children from head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Nearly every child has a scooter and they ride extremely fast,often with both feet on the scooter. We need to protect our children's heads. Pavements are notorious for trip hazards-tree roots, drain covers, cracked paving and when scooting at the speed they do, they don't have time to react or brake to prevent the scooter tipping and risking a head injury.  Bones and scrapes heal but a head injury is extremely dangerous and could be easily prevented by protecting the head using a helmet.

attributes.action: Ban vaping in public places
attributes.background: Not enough is known about vaping and its long-term health effects. The Government shouldn’t allow vaping in public places such as public transport. Let’s protect our children and treat it as a potential health problem of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
This article says that there are potential health issues with vaping and more needs to be learnt. Let’s protect ourselves and future generations now. 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/science/2018/jan/29/vaping-may-raise-cancer-and-heart-disease-risk-study-suggests

attributes.action: Tougher fines for Drivers that park in DISABLED SPACES
attributes.background: Disabled spaces are there for people that need them some of the most disabled and vulnerable people in our community, People get fined the same amount for parking in a space and over staying there paid parking ticket they have bought from a machine.
attributes.additional_details: People who park in a disabled space without a blue badge show total disregard for the people who need them the most, the punishment should be harsher why should they pay the same as someone over staying there paid ticket?

attributes.action: Introduce a Licencing system for cyclists and tighten up cycle law.
attributes.background:
Recently a facebook post caused horror and cyclists regularly show little regard for other road users and the law.

Please debate introducing a licence, at least with theory tests similar to other vehicles, which all cyclists must pass and must carry at all times and have 3rd party insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
I once received verbal abuse from a cyclist feeling I was in the wrong. I had dash cam footage reviewed by the police who were horrified how many highway code points the cyclist broke. The cyclist could not be traced so no action was taken but it's typical of the lack of knowledge of cyclists.

I am a horse rider, cyclist, motorcyclist, and car driver. The group I see least consideration for road users and frequent law breaking is cyclists.

attributes.action: Everyone must wear a helmet whilst riding their push bike or scooter by law
attributes.background:
It’s not acceptable that kids or adults ride their bikes or scooters without wearing helmets to protect them. 
If we can ride on roads we must be equipped to deal with road hazards
attributes.additional_details: Australia, New Zealand and America have laws that mean it is illegal to ride your bike of scooter without a helmet. The cost to the NHS if you sustain a brain injury as a result of not wearing a helmet is massive far more than the price of a helmet.

attributes.action: 'None of the above' as option on ballot paper
attributes.background:
Party Politics can often be seen as a 'Least worst option'.
If we had the option on the ballot paper to indicate 'none of the above' then this positive act would be reflected in the turnout .
attributes.additional_details: The strength of a democracy is measured, in part, by the turnout at elections. This option would increase the intelligence as to what the electorate view of politicians really looks like. As opposed to voting for 'the least worst option'.

attributes.action: Make £2.00 the most any catering company/school/borough can charge for hot food
attributes.background: I would like the UK government to introduce a maximum that any school ,catering company or borough can charge students to eat the hot food or main meal that the school serves.
attributes.additional_details: The price of hot food in schools across the UK has increased by an average of 5% over the past 4 years.The unjust increase means that some children have to buy food from shops, which would be harmless if  the food that children were buying was healthy but that isn't the case unfortunately in most situations snacks like crisps sweets and biscuits are less healthy than an actual meal but are a lot less expensive.Adults have pay to much for school food.

attributes.action: Public Inquiry into the actions of South Yorkshire Police at Orgreave 1984
attributes.background: At Orgreave, South Yorkshire Police ordered officers to charge "a largely peaceful crowd" & evidence given by South Yorkshire Police (SYP) has been described as "the biggest frame-up ever", SYP had a culture of fabricating evidence, which was not corrected by the time of the Hillsborough disaster.

attributes.action: Include teaching ‘self examination’ in health/sex education in schools.
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with breast cancer ive learnt that early detection really does save lives.How many truly check and know their bodies?In school we are taught sex ed/hygiene. Teaching to routinely self examine the correct way in this lesson would bring body awareness and in turn early detection
attributes.additional_details: My intention with this petition is that if self examination is introduced to the health/sex Education curriculum then self checking would become part of our daily lives and routines like washing/cleaning teeth/wearing deodorant. ..whilst in the shower we check ourselves. Right now we don’t all do it because we weren’t taught too from a young age and it’s not routine. This needs to change and be taught in schools, early detection does save lives it is so important to know your body!

attributes.action: Make a paid counsellor available for all students in every secondary school
attributes.background: Adolescents aged 11-19 attend secondary school. Ages that bring their own personal, intimate difficulties and ups & downs. They are finding it harder mental health problems. There are many more school nurses on site than counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Figures suggest 20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year, that 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14 with 75% established by age 24. In 2004 10% of children and young people aged 5-16 years had a clinically diagnosable mental health problem; yet in 2008 one study suggested 70% of children & adolescents who experienced mental health problems had not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. It is thought 13% of adolescents try to self harm between ages 11-16. Figures in 2014 suggested a 70% increase in A&E admissions for self-harm over the previous two years.

attributes.action: Ban pet shops from selling tortoises
attributes.background: Pet shops do not know how to provide the right care for these reptiles and keep them in the wrong conditions also some are too young to be sold and some are sold when they are ill and die later on.
attributes.additional_details: I bought a tortoise from the local pet shop it was way to young to be sold a little time later it died. I'm not happy with the conditions these poor animals are kept in and I would like it stopped. I would not like any other person or the poor reptiles to experience this.

attributes.action: Better health care and awareness for young people with respiratory conditions.
attributes.background: As a young person who suffers from severe Asthma, I've only recently started getting the medical treatment i needed after a lifetime of suffering from the condition (17 years). Unfortunately this is the same for many young people and this is something i would like to change.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, GP's are not educated enough about the severity of asthma and other respiratory conditions such as COPD. Hospital treatments are only temporary such as nebulisers and steroid medication and after this, GP's do not provide the sufficient checks to make sure an "attack" does not happen again. Asthma UK and COPD both do fundraising to raise awareness of the severity of both conditions and I feel like the government and the public could do more to help.

attributes.action: Ban quad bikes in residential areas
attributes.background: Loud and aggressively speeding quadbikes are everywhere in residential areas morning evening nights. They so loud that my 4 months old son is terrified of them. It’s very normal to see a quadbike speeding 40-50 mph in 20-30 mph zone.
attributes.additional_details:
These quadbike riders do not have any respect for speed limits. 
No respect if someone is ill at home needs rest. 
So loud that little babies waking up screaming. 
And above all safety of our kids on the roads just outside your home.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Dog to be recognised as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I have mental health problems, anxiety and depression. My dog helps me get out; keeps me calm in town when it's crowded and stops me acting on suicidal thoughts. My dog has given me a reason to get out of bed. Surely this will also help the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: I have also spoken to other people with mental health and found their dogs have been a huge help to them.”

attributes.action: Make dementia training mandatory within the NHS and hospitals.
attributes.background: Help me change how people living with dementia can have a better quality of care when visiting the hospital and being treated by staff with very little or no experience and  knowledge of the disease and also help the staff to better their knowledge and understanding of dementia.
attributes.additional_details: Elderly lady living with dementia in a care home setting had a fall as was taken to A & E due to NHS staff ( GP's, OT's, Radiographers and nurses ) lack of understanding and knowledge of dementia. She was sedated unnecessarily as they said she was a risk to herself.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: Please tell Theresa May to withdraw her invitation to tyrant Prayuth Chan-Ocha
attributes.background:
Theresa May has invited Thai dictator Prayuth to the UK on June 20 and hopes to agree new arms deals.
We are UK-based Thais who want democracy and human rights. Please support our message to May: 
Don’t welcome Prayuth to Britain. Tell him to restore Thai democracy. Don’t sell arms to the junta.
attributes.additional_details:
Prayuth seized power in an illegal coup in 2014, overthrowing elected leader Yingluck Shinawatra. The junta has used dictatorial power to repress human rights, prosecute critics of military rule, ban political activity, censor media, and try dissidents in unfair military courts. 

Prayuth was also army chief in 2010 when the military launched a violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters. More than 90 people were killed and nearly 2,000 wounded.

attributes.action: Remove Arriva of their contract for disruptions to people and the economy
attributes.background:
Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%

We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards.

attributes.action: Recall of MPs Act to include failure of MPs to abide by Constituents’ wishes
attributes.background: The Recall of MPs Act 2015 is very limited in scope. It only covers when an MPs is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.  It should be extended to allow for the recall of MPs that ignore the wishes of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.additional_details: A third reason for the Recall of an MP should include acting contrary to their Election Manifesto, by for example voting against something they promised, and acting contrary to the wishes of the majority of their constituents as expressed in a national or local referendum.

attributes.action: Bring in free bus pass concessions at age 60 in England.
attributes.background:
Free bus travel is available to people from aged 60 in Scotland, Wales and Northern ireland
The date at which you can apply for a bus pass in England is state pensionable age (currently 2023) if you are now age 60. This is geographical discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: A Senior Railcard is available to anyone aged 60 or over. There should be no distinction in age for a concession on bus or rail transport, or where you live in the UK. All transport concessions should be from age 60 regardless of where you live in the UK.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to devolve Yorkshire into a country.
attributes.background: As a student in the heart of Yorkshire, I believe it is the fundamental right for citizens of Yorkshire to have greater power over their society, economy and environment.
attributes.additional_details: This is why I am proposing to start a referendum to decide whether the people of Yorkshire want to be independent from England but remain in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: To allow funeral processions to use all Bus Lanes.
attributes.background: I am a Funeral Director based in South London Area and in my time of conducting funerals i have found that traffic in London is terrible. Although we do our very best on planning funerals and always allowing extra time, you can never anticipate 100% on what traffic will be like during your journey.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe that i speak on behalf of all funeral directors and families that have been late to lay their loved ones to rest because we have been caught in unexpected traffic. It will ease the worry on so many levels and keep the dignity to the end. Having use of bus lanes, im my opinion and experience, will substantially lower the chances of ourselves, our grieving families and any member of our community being late for the most important journey in our lifetime.....our final one!

attributes.action: Make a legal temperature where it is too hot to attend work or school.
attributes.background: It is too hot for us to work effectively and efficiently this is damaging our health and education.
attributes.additional_details: This is a cause for medical concern as people are fainting and becoming dehydrated due to lack of air conditioning and shaded areas in certain work places and schools.

attributes.action: Full funding for Aflibercept, Bevacizumab,Lapatinib,Eribulin, Everolimus
attributes.background: I have cancer and I believe that the drug Bevacizmab would help my treatment and it is not currently funded by the NHS.

attributes.action:
Introduce laws to prevent insult to 
religions and religious personalities.
attributes.background: The world is seeing a rise in disturbing trends of extremism in society that seek to create a fear, suspicion and hate towards Muslims masked under the guise of freedom of expression, nationalism and patriotism.
attributes.additional_details: Early 20th century anti-Semitic propaganda of the Nazis sought to control the news and information to the people that ultimately resulted in the expulsion and mass murder of millions of Jews in Europe. In the current climate powerful groups of people and individuals have been emboldened by a belief that it is their right to offend, ridicule and target an entire faith community (Islam and Muslims), by creating a climate of fear and suspicion under the guise of freedom of speech and expression.

attributes.action: NHS & Social Care Services to adopt the Edith Ellen Foundation Kindness Charter.
attributes.background: As there is little evidence of improvements in addressing unsafe and poor care services, the Government should aim for one standardised quality of care everyone can trust by requiring the NHS and social care providers to adopt this charter.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.edithellenfoundation.org/the-kindness-charter/

attributes.action: Take the UK out of the EU's Customs Union in 2021 as promised.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned are deeply unhappy that the Government has decided to keep the UK in the Customs Union beyond the Brexit transition/implementation period.
attributes.additional_details: We further reject the use of the Irish Border "problem" as the reason for this decision (the so-called "backstop") and therefore call upon the British Government to immediately reverse this decision and keep its promise to the British people that the UK will be leaving the Customs Union at the end of the transition/implementation period in 2021.

attributes.action: The UK should create a Blockchain Act to support the new tokenized economy
attributes.background: Our legal infrastructure needs to provide a foundation for proper digital signing with private keys, and support the legal consequences of the ownership, possession and transfer of tokens.
attributes.additional_details:
A Blockchain Act will support the new tokenized economy, and where real-world applications around blockchain can be enacted with legal certainty. These tokens include: payment tokens (currency coins); utility tokens (services); and security tokens (equity and assets). 

Liechtenstein's Blockchain Act defines its objective as to:

"enable the transformation of the ‘real’ world to blockchain systems while ensuring legal certainty, thereby opening up the full application potential of the token economy."

The UK Act should aim to define “legal certainty” for blockchain implementation and projects, and define a world where our existing assets are added onto blockchain, and then traded there.

attributes.action: Stop the plans to add folic acid to flour because of allergies
attributes.background: News that folic acid is to be added to flour could be bad news for the future health of children. Folic acid during pregnancy has been linked to food allergies in later childhood. Increased allergies increase the burden on NHS. Some allergies are potentially fatal.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent medical research https://www.medpagetoday.com/meetingcoverage/aaaai/71566
 
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5949539/
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/POST-PN-467/POST-PN-467.pdf
 
Increasing allergies 
https://www.allergyuk.org/information-and-advice/statistics
 
Increasing food allergies in children and death 
https://amp.theguardian.com/society/2018/oct/01/why-are-food-allergies-in-children-on-the-rise-and-is-there-anything-parents-can-do-to-protect-them

attributes.action: Make it illegal to photograph children in public places without parental consent
attributes.background: I was recently in a park in Newcastle when a man I didn’t know approached my 3 year old son and crouched down in front on him within touching distance and started taking his photo on his phone. I was disturbed by this and contacted the police to be told it is legal and there is nothing they can do.
attributes.additional_details:
Quote taken from Wikipedia:

‘Photography of certain subject matter is restricted in the United Kingdom. In particular, the Protection of Children Act 1978 restricts making or possessing pornography of children under 18, or what looks like pornography of under-18s. There is no law prohibiting photographing children in public spaces’ 

As my son was fully clothed it was not illegal for a stranger to photograph him without my consent. This I feel is worryingly wrong and does not protect our children.

attributes.action: Require fast food chains to replace promotional images with actual burgers sold
attributes.background: We demand a reality check for large fast food chains. They should be required to replace the unrealistic images in their restaurants with photos of actual burgers that have been cooked in the restaurant, so we can ensure customers know what they are paying for.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media - ShowMeTheBurger
www.showmetheburger.co.uk

attributes.action: Mental health services to become accessible  24/7 including help line funding
attributes.background: After suffering from mental health issues and also close family members I realised that unless you are in a mental health crisis between the hours of 9 - 4.30 Monday to Friday help is few and far between unless you contact 999. The government need to fund help lines with trained professionals.
attributes.additional_details: There are at least 10 different help lines out of these 10 there are only 2 open out of hours . One of these is only voluntary based not professional help and the other is professional led but is so over run with people needing there help they can't keep up . There are millions of people suffering ,the suicide rate is higher than ever with a vast majority of these happening " out of hours" ie weekends evening and nights more needs to be done to take this seriously so that this doesn't happen to another loved one

attributes.action: Suspend the lease rental rule change from 130g/km emissions to 110g/km ASAP
attributes.background:
New lease rental restriction bands from April 2018 are negatively impacting company new car sales contributing to job losses across the UK.
Employees paying company car tax support’s the Treasury coffers by millions of pounds, but is in serious decline due too many alterations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/lease-rental-restrictions/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/company-car-tax-to-change-over-to-new-wltp-emission-rules-from-april-2020/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/new-202021-company-car-tax-bands-favour-ultra-low-emission-vehicles/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/

attributes.action: Clamp down on sexual harassment in clubs with nationally enforced regulations
attributes.background: Sexual harassment is an endemic issue faced by women on nights out in this country. It is disgraceful in 2018 that persistent unwanted attention and groping are just part of going out for women. Clubs and live music venues must appoint trained staff inside their premises to combat this issue
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is either existing staff are redistributed or new bouncers appointed to monitor the inside of the clubs. These bouncers would be easily visible so women can report any perpetuators without trouble and feel more safe and comfortable on nights out. Funding required in some cases could be provided by the government

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections
attributes.background: Under our present electoral system the distribution of seats among the political parties bears no close relation to the total votes cast for those parties. In 2017, the average number of votes cast nationally for each party varied between just under 28,000 and over 525,000 votes per seat won.
attributes.additional_details:
This is unfair and unsustainable: since 2005 two general elections have produced no overall majority, and two have produced majorities which each resulted from just over one third of the votes cast.
20 years ago the Jenkins Commission recommended a proportional system to replace First Past the Post. A 2011 referendum offered instead the AV system which Jenkins had rejected as it is not proportional.
We therefore call upon Parliament to hold a referendum on the Jenkins Commission recommendation.

attributes.action: Stop Councils charging disabled people for the cost of care and support at home
attributes.background: I am 23 years old. I have profound Learning Difficulties with complex health needs. Currently, I live at home with my mum and dad who provide a roof over my head, saving the government a huge amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: The councils are using the term Fairer Contribution Financial Assessment for Social Care to charge disabled people extra money to balance their books. This is an indirect cut to my benefits as well as to my care package. The main principles of the Care Act are well- being, these charges are going to impact on health.

attributes.action: Student healthcare professionals to earn apprenticeship wage during placement.
attributes.background: Student healthcare professionals are under the equivalent pressure that all registered NHS professionals are, if not more as they have to cope with living costs, studying and handling all of the stress that the NHS has to offer at the age of 18+. This could be student paramedics, nurses, doctors etc
attributes.additional_details: Although students are not yet qualified they work just as hard and put in an immense amount of effort to gain their degree to practice. We take for granted the NHS and all those that work for it so let’s make a change and make it worthwhile and easier for those aspiring healthcare professionals.

attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Provide gym access to all who make national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: Our wonderful NHS is under constant pressure to provide care in our times of need. Targeting healthier living whilst we are able, our times of need may reduce. Some of the costs to becoming healthier should be eradicated and the emphasis placed on exercise becoming an expectation in adult life.
attributes.additional_details: I propose government funded gyms to all who make national insurance contributions. With funds contributed between employer, employee and government. Health is just as important as your pension, and an investment into personal health can only pay us all back. There are many reasons exercise benefits our physical and mental health.

attributes.action: Have the A1 & A2 Motorcycle Licence automatically upgrade after 2 years
attributes.background:
Upgrade the A1 to a A2 after 2 years. 
Upgrade the A2 to a full licence after 2 years. 
Car drivers can drive a vehicle with any power after one test, why can't us bikers? 
At least with 2 years experience of each licence, surely that is enough experience to be given the privilege to move up.
attributes.additional_details: Bikers must complete a CBT test for a 125. Then another test for the A1 licence, that is for a 125 again. It consists of a theory test, a module 1 and a module 2. Then bikers have to wait to be older anyway to go for the A2 licence that again consists of a module 1 & a module 2 , then for the full A licence they must do another module 1 and module 2 test. To prepare for the tests, training is needed consisting at least 5 lessons costing a bomb and taking up alot your time. It's over kill.

attributes.action: A scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages
attributes.background:
My petition:

A new petition calling on the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages.
attributes.additional_details:
I find it terrible that people can’t get on the housing ladder. People can pay more in rent than others do who pay a mortgage. Let’s make it law that the Government set up a scheme to support banks and building societies to offer 100% mortgages to people who it can be shown can afford the monthy mortgage payment.

Governments under all colours have failed those who want to aspire to provide a loving and constant home environment for their children.

attributes.action: Create a regulated market for Ecstasy
attributes.background: Ecstasy a.k.a MDMA or Midomafetamine is a common class A recreational drug deeply infused within British rave and party culture. It has been used as a party drug since the 60’s. Its been illegal since 1977 but this hasnt stopped the shear number of people taking the drug.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a dangerous black market where many deaths have occured due to overdose or due to what has been mixed within the drug. This petition isnt trying to condone the use of the drug but to make a safe, regulated market where if the drug is to be used it is coming from a trustworthy and controlled source. This will ultimately reduce ODs, increase knowledge and education of the drug, create tax revenue, cut out the black market AND SAVE LIVES! Please do some of your own research:)

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
